name: Supergateway
description:
Supergateway runs MCP stdio-based servers over SSE (Server-Sent Events), WebSockets (WS), or Streamable HTTP with one command. This is useful for remote access, debugging, or connecting to clients when your MCP server only supports stdio.

Features:
- stdio → SSE: Expose MCP stdio servers as SSE endpoints
- stdio → WebSocket: Expose MCP stdio servers as WS endpoints
- stdio → Streamable HTTP: Expose MCP stdio servers as HTTP endpoints
- SSE → stdio: Connect to remote SSE servers and expose locally
- Streamable HTTP → stdio: Connect to remote HTTP servers and expose locally
- CORS support with customizable origins
- OAuth2 Bearer token authentication
- Health check endpoints
author: supercorp-ai

form_fields.label: MCP Command (stdio mode)
form_fields.hint: Command to run MCP server in stdio mode (e.g., 'npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /data')

form_fields.label: SSE URL (SSE→stdio mode)
form_fields.hint: URL of remote SSE MCP server to connect to (e.g., 'https://mcp-server.example.com/sse')

form_fields.label: Streamable HTTP URL
form_fields.hint: URL of remote Streamable HTTP MCP server (e.g., 'https://mcp-server.example.com/mcp')

form_fields.label: Output Transport
form_fields.hint: Output transport: sse, ws, streamableHttp, or stdio (default: sse)

form_fields.label: OAuth2 Bearer Token
form_fields.hint: Bearer token for Authorization header (for remote connections)

form_fields.label: CORS Origins
form_fields.hint: Allowed CORS origins (comma-separated, leave empty for all)

form_fields.label: Log Level
form_fields.hint: Log level: debug, info, or none (default: info)
